result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, surcharges be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

No firearms, ammunition, body armor.  No voting until rights have been restored.
 No alcohol or drugs.
No dangerous weapons.
No contact with Value Beauty, Pizza Hut./D.H., Mobil Gas station/J.J., Scotties Pizzeria, M.H., A.W., W.B., Little Caesar's on 76th Street or R.C.

Absolute/maintain sobriety.  RAndom urine screens, testing.
Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment  deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not voteuntil his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: 7/25/17 sentencing transcript

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel placed off the record discussion on the record. Defense counsel's request for an adjournment of the sentencing hearing DENIED by the Court.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 mONTHS with 360 (three hundred-sixty)  days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program. 

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- 25 hours of community service.
- Random urine screens (testing).
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No dangerous weapons.
- No contact with Value Beauty, Pizza Hut/DH, Mobel Gas Station/JJ, Scottie's Pizzeria, MH, AW, WB, Little Caesar's on 76th Street or RC:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution is set at $0 (zero); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines and surcharges be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Defense counsel informs Court that defendant has a pending case in Branch 28 and requests adjournment to the date as to that date.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.
